intro: Calceolaria trilobata subsp. chimborazensis, commonly known as the Chimborazo slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive calyx-shaped petals that resemble small slippers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, humid conditions with well-drained soil. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, are often adorned with intricate patterns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
